blog.name: genasade
blog.title: Shounen Scrub
blog.description: It was when man first realised that one spunky muscular dude punching another spunky muscular dude could be a form of entertainment, that the shounen scrub was born!

body:
Random thoughts

Ok I don’t have any evidence for this, but you know how All for One specifically chose Shigaraki because he was Nana’s grandchild and he wanted this to be his last hurrah of fuck you to All Might.

Imagine if All for One actually gave Shigaraki his quirk, knowing the disaster is could face (since, well, its a quirk that can destroy anything he touches, that suddenly appearing at the wrong time would be traumatising *cough* maybe holding onto a family memeber *cough*) so that child Shigaraki could fall into a pit of unfortunate events, traumatising him so that All for One could swoop in and act like he’s cares but he would just have an easier subject to build up from, creating him to despise the world and all might.

If this was true, it’d be so mind blowing and cruel.

summary: Can you draw Deku please? (Also I feel like you ship Deku x Todoroki, sorry but I ship Bakudoriya! Bakugou x Deku) Thanks for...
question: Can you draw Deku please? (Also I feel like you ship Deku x Todoroki, sorry but I ship Bakudoriya! Bakugou x Deku) Thanks for reading this! :3
answer:
A Deku based off the terrifying creature Horikoshi decided needed to be on the cover of the newest chapter

and yes! i do ship tododeku. I’m not as involved with it as some other ships coughs @ kiribaku, probably because they arent my favorite, favorite characters, but i like them together. ship what you please though- if youre having fun, its legal, and you arent forcing it down other people’s throats it doesnt matter  ✌️

blog.name: ao3feed-kiribaku
blog.title: Shitty Hair x Blasty Fanfics
blog.description:
☆Kirishima Eijirou/Bakugou Katsuki fanfics☆
☆Please check the FAQ before asking anything thank you☆
☆Created 3/18/2019, no fics from before this date can appear here☆

title: Mr Bakugou
description:
by Arandompsycho

It’s very common for teachers to “help” their newly presented students get though their first heats or ruts. It’s just something that happens, and the teachers always make very certain no one gets pregnant.

But something about a particular red headed omega stirs something in Bakugou. He just wants to make kirishima his.

Words: 1024, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

summary: “It all began in Keikei city in China, with news of a ring flying onto a baby’s finger. After that, rings began popping up all...
body:
“It all began in Keikei city in China, with news of a ring flying onto a baby’s finger. After that, rings began popping up all over the world. The cause was unclear. Time passed, and the rings became the norm. Currently, 80% of the world’s population possesses these powerful rings. The world is in chaos. And a profession that everyone once only dreamed about entered the spotlight.

With the rise of lantern rings, came an explosive increase in criminal activity. While governments were stuck trying to figure out how to reform laws with rings in mind, courageous people started performing heroic acts to keep our cities safe. Protecting us against villains who abuse their rings for evil.”

Thank you @hetawriter for the help coming up with this AU. The characters were traced in this art, and I just modified their suits to fit the AU. 

Read more about the world below the break. 

UA used to only allow green rings into the hero program, as green represents sheer will and bravery, but 5 years ago they began to let in ringless students. In the past, non-green students would apply as ringless to general studies and transfer to heroics class, but this is the first year UA allowed non-green students.

Green rings represent strong will, and the ability to overcome fear, perfect for the hero profession.

Blue rings represent the ability to instill hope in others, while those with Indigo rings show great compassion. Both of these rings tend to be worn by rescue heroes.

Violet rings are for those who feel great love, towards themselves or other people.

Yellow rings represent fear, both the ability to instill fear, as well as those who give in to their fear, and let it control them. Red rings represent rage and are worn by those who feel the rage and will let it control them. Both of these rings are worn by villains more than heroes, but that isn’t always the case.

Orange rings are worn by the greedy, and there is only one orange ring in this world.

Black rings represent death. Only those who are near death or cause a lot of death wear them. A ring made for true supervillains or people in great peril.

White rings are the most powerful, able to harness the entire emotional spectrum and comprising of all the colors. 

There are only 2 white rings in this world, one is wielded by All-for-One. The other white ring was special. It had the ability to be transferred from one person to another. All Might is the current holder but had begun to process to transfer his power to Izuku. The One-for-All ring had the ability to duplicate itself, but it doesn’t last. Once the new host gains the ring, the old host loses access to the power battery and only has a limited charge. When not in use, All-Might’s ring turns black. At times the white ring can be too powerful for Izuku, and if he isn’t careful, his ring will burn him where it touches.

All-for-One’s ring is different. His power battery is powered by the broken rings of his defeated foes, and he can use his own ring to fuse the remnants back together and implant them into his Nomus.

Despite being the current wielder of the orange ring, Endeavor wasn’t always orange. His ring used to be green, but after the death of his mentor, he tried to take his mentor’s ring. Dead men don’t need their rings. After that, his color changed. While he can focus enough to pass off as a green lantern, his constructs and ring stay orange, showing his true greed, not that anyone can tell.

In his quest for power, Endeavor tried to make his own son an orange lantern. When Todoroki got his ring, much to the horror of those around him, the ring was a bright yellow. Fear had taken over Shouto’s heart. Endeavor stole the ring away behind vaults of lead and crystal, forcing Todoroki to use the blue ring his mother once wore, turning the once brilliant cerulean light a deep, depressing green. During the sports festival of class 1A, while facing off against Izuku, Todoroki’s true power awakened and his ring broke free of its bindings and came to him, breaking his mother’s ring, and taking its place on his right hand.

When Iida first got his ring and started going to UA it was green, the color of a true hero. However, after the Hero Killer attacked and paralyzed his brother, Iida couldn’t forgive the villain and discovered his ring was now red. He was so focused on his own vengeance, he forgot what it was to be a true hero. Someday, his ring will become green again, and when that happens, he will proudly take up the name of Ingenium. But until then, with rage as his guide, Iida runs with vengeance at his side.

Dead men don’t need their rings. After that, his color changed. While he can focus enough to pass off as a green lantern, his constructs and ring stay orange, showing his true greed, not that anyone can tell.

In his quest for power, Endeavor tried to make his own son an orange lantern. When Todoroki got his ring, much to the horror of those around him, the ring was a bright yellow. Fear had taken over Shouto’s heart. Endeavor stole the ring away behind vaults of lead and crystal, forcing Todoroki to use the blue ring his mother once wore, turning the once brilliant cerulean light a deep, depressing green. During the sports festival of class 1A, while facing off against Izuku, Todoroki’s true power awakened and his ring broke free of its bindings and came to him, breaking his mother’s ring, and taking its place on his right hand.

When Iida first got his ring and started going to UA it was green, the color of a true hero. However, after the Hero Killer attacked and paralyzed his brother, Iida couldn’t forgive the villain and discovered his ring was now red. He was so focused on his own vengeance, he forgot what it was to be a true hero. Someday, his ring will become green again, and when that happens, he will proudly take up the name of Ingenium. But until then, with rage as his guide, Iida runs with vengeance at his side.
trail.content_abstract:
“It all began in Keikei city in China, with news of a ring flying onto a baby’s finger. After that, rings began popping up all over the world. The cause was unclear. Time passed, and the rings became the norm. Currently, 80% of the world’s population possesses these powerful rings. The world is in chaos. And a profession that everyone once only dreamed about entered the spotlight.

With the rise of lantern rings, came an explosive increase in criminal activity. While governments were stuck trying to figure out how to reform laws with rings in mind, courageous people started performing heroic acts to keep our cities safe. Protecting us against villains who abuse their rings for evil.”

Thank you @hetawriter for the help coming up with this AU. The characters were traced in this art, and I just modified their suits to fit the AU. 

Read more about the world below the break.

Idk how. I sketched it so fast, and a whole abo AU came to me. The premise:

What’s that scar you got there Midoriya?

summary: re: chapter 222, i’m sort of wondering if shigaraki’s memories that were brought up are actually real...? there’s a part in the...
body:
re: chapter 222, i’m sort of wondering if shigaraki’s memories that were brought up are actually real…?

there’s a part in the chapter where the doctor asks afo if they should remove his memories, but afo says to leave them to teach him pain and suffering and that’s… really peculiar to me. shiraraki said he doesn’t remember much from before afo

and he didn’t actually seem to remember killing his family until afo and the doctor told him about it 

he’s obviously very young in these flashbacks, but he’s old enough to 1. have developed his quirk and 2. speak, so he’s old enough to have developed solid concise memories. it’s possible he could’ve repressed these memories, but they couldn’t have happened that long ago and the way he ‘recalls’ them is also strange. 

plus, he doesn’t even seem to recall the actual memories, given this line: 

earlier in the chapter, he even says that he had no clear memories until afo hugged him:

‘until then, i was completely empty’ makes it sound as if he had no real notable memories, or his memory had been wiped clean. and from this line the doctor says, we can assume that’s possible

i don’t think these are shigaraki’s actual memories. 

i think his memory was messed with. i think afo decided to try to hit nana/all might where it hurts the most and take in one of nana’s only relatives, who happened to develop a rare, dangerous mutation and i think he wiped shigaraki’s memory clean and then implemented these ideas of him killing his family in order to force shigaraki to be dependent on him and only him and to help destroy the idea that anyone else (heroes) would come help him.

blog.name: mylifeisalieandididntknow
blog.title: We were put here on this earth to feel joy

tags: era before quirks became the norm
body:
Crossover idea of the day.

Incredibles x bnha

Before heroes became the majority, a swlect few were chosen by the government to up hold the mantle of what it means to be a hero. Then Mr. Incredible started a trend that lead to the down fall of the hero system. Many years later more and more people are being born with quirks and the hero system is implemented once more. With much more stricter rules.
